text: Israel competed at the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City, United States. The Israeli delegation included 5 athletes. 2 pairs of ice dancers: Galit Chait and Sergei Sakhnovski, who were ranked in 6th place, and Natalia Gudina and Alexei Beletski, who were 19th. Olga Danilova competed in short track speed skating.Israel at the 2002 Salt Lake City Winter Games ==Results by event== ===Figure skating=== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- ! rowspan="2"|Athlete(s) ! rowspan="2"|Event ! ! ! / ! / ! colspan="2"|Total |- ! ! ! ! ! !Rank |-align="center" |align="left"|Galit Chait & Sergei Sakhnovski |align="left" rowspan=2|Ice dancing |6 |6 |6 |6 |12.0 |6 |-align="center" |align="left"|Natalia Gudina & Alexei Beletski |19 |19 |19 |19 |38.0 |19 |} ===Short track speed skating=== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Gender !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Quarterfinal !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align="center" |rowspan="3"|Women's |align="left" rowspan=3|Olga Danilov |align="left"|500m |46.422 |2 Q |46.695 |4 |colspan=3|Did not advance |16 |-align="center" |align="left"|1000m |1:42.767 |3 |colspan=5|Did not advance |21 |-align="center" |align="left"|1500m |2:32.458 |3 Q |2:36.114 |5 |colspan=3|Did not finish |14 |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2002 Winter Olympics 2002 Winter Olympics Winter Olympics
